document.masterDocTitle: Revision of world Austroterobiinae and Parasaphodinae (Hymenoptera: Chalcidoidea: Pteromalidae), parasitoids of giant scales (Hemiptera: Coccoidea: Monophlebidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of world Austroterobiinae and Parasaphodinae (Hymenoptera: Chalcidoidea: Pteromalidae), parasitoids of giant scales (Hemiptera: Coccoidea: Monophlebidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Parasaphes flavipes Ashmead, 1904: 157
; syntypes in USNM, examined.
Parasaphodes flavipes (Ashmead, 1904)
,
comb. nov.

So far, this is the only species of
Parasaphodes
having a large quadrangular petiole ( Fig. 141 ) and a relatively long scape ( Figs 135, 137 ).

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Material examined. Lectotype ♀ (designated here for nomenclatural stability, deposited in USNM ) [both antennae broken beyond F5, but rest of the segments from one of the antennae glued beneath the specimen; right side middle leg broken but glued beneath the specimen; distal segments of all tarsi missing; part of the body and wings covered by white mold; on triangular card].
CHINA ( TAIWAN) :
‘1366’, ‘ Formosa , Koebele’ , ‘ Type No . 7187 U.S. N.M.’, ‘ Parasaphes flavipes ♂ ♀ Ash’ [ Ashmead’s handwriting], ‘USNMENT00802940’.

Paralectotypes .
CHINA ( TAIWAN) :
2♀ ‘1366’, ‘ Formosa , Koebele’ , ‘ Type No . 7187 U.S. N.M.’ ( USNM ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 132–134.
Parasaphodes flavipes
, lectotype ♀: 132, habitus, lateral view; 133, habitus, dorsal view; 134, original labels.

FIGURES 135–142.
Parasaphodes flavipes
: 135, lectotype ♀, head, frontal view; 136, lectotype ♀, head, dorsal view; 137, lectotype ♀, head, lateral view; 138, lectotype ♀, antenna; 139, lectotype ♀, mesosoma, dorsal view; 140, lectotype ♀, mesosoma, lateral view; 141, paralectotype ♀, propodeum, dorsal view; 142, lectotype ♀, fore wing.

subSubSection.paragraph: Biology. According to Ashmead (1904), the specimens were “bred by Mr. A . Koebele” (p. 157); however, no host is given.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 143.
Teasienna
sp., ♀, habitus, dorsal view, part of the original type series of
P. flavipes
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks. The type series of
P. flavipes
consists of six point-mounted specimens, of which two are missing from their points; they are all more or less covered by white mold. A third specimen, having the same information as the paralectotypes , proved to be a
Teasienna
female ( Fig. 143 ). It has its left antenna and both fore wings missing, the right antenna is broken beyond the second anellus, and the mandibles are not visible. However, it has the posteroventral corner of the pronotum short and rounded, the posterior margin of the gena round, the medial ventral margin of the scape carinate, the antenna inserted below the middle of the face, and the posterior part of the mesoscutellum conspicuously overpassing the base of propodeum, with a small median spine ( Fig. 143 ).
